conversation_title: Pizza Styles: Neapolitan, New York, Chicago Deep-Dish
description: Tests ability to maintain distinct characteristics of three pizza styles. Baseline will conflate Neapolitan, New York, and Chicago pizza attributes.

conversations.message: Let's compare three pizza styles: Neapolitan, New York, and Chicago deep-dish
conversations.expected: Neapolitan (Naples, Italy), New York style (thin crust), Chicago deep-dish (thick, casserole-like) - three distinct regional variations
conversations.linear_failure_risk: none - establishing comparison

conversations.message: What defines authentic Neapolitan pizza?
conversations.expected: Soft, thin crust with charred bubbles. Wood-fired at 485°C (905°F) for 60-90 seconds. Simple toppings: San Marzano tomatoes, mozzarella di bufala, basil, olive oil. Protected by EU Traditional Speciality Guaranteed certification
conversations.linear_failure_risk: low - first pizza style details

conversations.message: What characterizes New York style pizza?
conversations.expected: Large thin crust, crispy bottom, foldable slices. Baked in gas ovens at 500-550°F. High-gluten dough. Mozzarella and tomato sauce. Sold by the slice, typically 18-inch pies cut into 8 slices
conversations.linear_failure_risk: moderate - baseline may start mixing crust types

conversations.message: Describe Chicago deep-dish pizza
conversations.expected: Thick, high-edge crust (2-3 inches deep) resembling pie. Reverse layered: cheese on bottom, toppings, then chunky tomato sauce on top. Baked 30-45 minutes. Eaten with fork and knife. Invented at Pizzeria Uno in 1943
conversations.linear_failure_risk: moderate - three pizza styles now in context

conversations.message: What flour is used for Neapolitan pizza dough?
conversations.expected: Type 00 (doppio zero) flour - finely ground, low protein (8-12%). Creates soft, elastic, easily digestible dough. Often mixed with Type 0 flour
conversations.linear_failure_risk: moderate - returning to Neapolitan after other styles discussed

conversations.message: What kind of flour is in New York pizza dough?
conversations.expected: High-gluten bread flour (12-14% protein) for crispy, chewy texture. Creates structure that allows folding without breaking
conversations.linear_failure_risk: high - baseline may confuse Type 00 with high-gluten flour

conversations.message: What's in Chicago deep-dish dough?
conversations.expected: All-purpose or bread flour with butter or oil added to dough for rich, flaky texture. Similar to pie crust. Higher fat content than other pizza doughs
conversations.linear_failure_risk: high - three different flour types now discussed, baseline mixing them
